text:
HubL idea: How about the ability to allow us to create custom modules/parent modules which support the dropping of other modules within them. Essentially allowing us to create custom “Module Groups”.
(much like when specifying wrapping HTML in the Module Group config:

```<div class="wrap"><div class="pad">{{ html }}</div></div>```
Would a flexible column work for you?
if you are coding your templates you can create partials.

Yeah, I’m actually using both. However, this was more for a marketplace theme - I was initially trying to make the theme as flexible as possible without the clunky requirement of having to add classes to columns/module groups to set a background.
Maybe i just keep classes for now :smile:

Would be really nice to have a true related posts function instead of a tag with built-in markup: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags#blog-related-posts>

Current use-case: this site has some posts that do not have featured images, but do show up in "related posts" listings. Would be nice to be able to use |selectattr or if-else logic based on the posts returned
Module ideas: Ability to categorise custom modules in the page editing experience, maybe allowing developers to specify a category in meta.json. Looks like the module list could get pretty long!
This would be so useful as we have over 100 modules
